instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936B: What is 820-2936B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: USB ports dont recognize, power lights work. (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) Macbook Pro 13 Mid-2011
threads.message: When Flash Drives or external USB drives are plugged in they show power and the respective LED's say they are working, but the OS never recognizes that anything has been plugged in.  Checked continuity on L4605.L4600,L4615,L4610 while in circuit. Since the power is working, my assumption is that it is in the data lines. Not sure where to go on troubleshooting from here.  Note: This is my first post to this forum and I am relatively new to component level repair.

threads.title: USB ports dont recognize, power lights work. (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) Macbook Pro 13 Mid-2011
threads.message: Replace  L4605.L4600,L4615,L4610.Continuity wont test these at high frequencies.

threads.title: USB ports dont recognize, power lights work. (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) Macbook Pro 13 Mid-2011
threads.message:
It's unusual for all ports not to work. Are any other USB devices working normally like Blue Tooth and camera, trackpad/keyboard?
Diode mode on both data pins of each port?
